intro: Lavandula stoechas subsp. maderensis, commonly known as the Portuguese lavender, is a subspecies native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and aromatic foliage. This plant typically grows in rocky or sunny habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in Mediterranean climates. The subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and essential oil production.
